meanings.definition: A device used to measure the strength and direction of a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The magnetometer showed the north direction of the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a magnetometer to study Earth's magnetic field.
meanings.sent3: The magnetometer decided to only measure magnetic fields on Mondays.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like a magnetometer, always pointing her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The magnetometer hummed softly as it analyzed the magnetic field.

meanings.definition: An instrument that detects the presence of ferrous metals.
meanings.sent1: The security guard used a magnetometer to find hidden metal objects.
meanings.sent2: At the airport, passengers walk through a magnetometer for safety.
meanings.sent3: The magnetometer at the museum beeped loudly when someone tried to sneak in with metal.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like a magnetometer, immediately spotting any metal in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magnetometer buzzed with excitement whenever it detected metal nearby.
